posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
Just something that came to me... I wanted a pure-as-possible monk and started from monk40 (speed, UA damage, SR), but Epic Dodge and Self-Concealment were highly desired. 

Elf for the Dexterity bump. Shadowdancer gets me Epic Dodge. Harper came from searching for a 3rd flavor to add (monk35/SD5 seemed strong), it let me squeeze in SCV and an extra +1 dexterity. This was at the cost of some monk speed and AC, stunning fist DC, 10 SR...

It seems like it is a bit stronger with the Harper Scout added, but less of a dedicated Mage killer maybe?

Opinions? Comments? Ideas? Inspirations?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I like the use of Harper to get Great Dex and access to Cat's Grace and potion of Cat's Grace.

I think it is a cool idea, good thinking outside of the box.

What I do think is something to consider, is the feat cost (pre-req for HS) and skill costs, and lack of UMD.  If only HS had UMD...wouldn't that be something?

ED and 50% Concealment is a powerful combination imo.  It does sort of make the Monk ability Empty Body a bit useless, however. 

In any regards, whenever I see some HS in a build, it always catches my attention.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I like it, MD! I had similar intent in my Truesilver's Hand build, but with less focus on SC - letting Defensive Awareness, HiPS and ED take more of the strain as a Monk 30/ SD 5/ DwD 5. I only include it here for compare and contrast purposes: the stats are broadly similar. Nice to see HS come out for a stroll in the sun!

Cheers

posts.content: Because a Monk has Empty Body, SC5 is perhaps not needed.  If you went with Monk 35 / SD 5, you would have 35 rounds of 50% concealment twice a day from Empty Body, which cannot be dispelled.

RE Harper Scout - up to you, 2 dex is great *I think* the Harper Cat's *might* stack with standard Cat's when I looked it up months ago. But not 100% sure.
If you dropped it you have lots of choices, rogue seems nice for 1d6-3d6 sneak attack damage combined with 5-7 APR.  Fighter 5 you can get epic weapon specialization if you take EWS as a general epic feat on a fighter 5 level. Multiclass penalty with both, assassin and CoT/Blackguard/Arcane Archer (for BAB 26+) being alternatives to dodge the multiclass penalties.
RE Epic Level Feats - I like Epic Prowess and Armor Skin. The other feats could be Improved Spell Resistance, Epic Fortitude (those darn Implosions that go through death immunity, although with that monk speed you *could* kind of dodge them, if you aren't mobbed), even toughness / great constitution to push the base HP closer to 400 for a meleer. Up to you what you like really. Epic Energy Resistances depend on the environment and what you are facing. 
RE UMD - its a powerful skill
RE Assassin - can understand the issues with being an evil assassin monk

Tumble can be 40 ranks in the build rather than 43 btw

Edit: The Harper Cat's Grace Feat (but not crafted potion) appeared to stack with standard Cat's Grace spell/potion when I playtested it in July 2019 preparing this guide.
